{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3322305,"name":"Leo","username":"_leo","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/_/87869e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-03T01:03:45.044Z","cooked":"

Today my team was testing our code for automatically aiming at the speaker using a button on the driver controller. We’re using wpilib’s SwerveDrivePoseEstimator with a limelight to locate the robot on the field and then calculate the correct direction to rotate the robot to and the correct angle to aim the shooter. Most of the time while driving, the robot knows where it is and correctly aims at the speaker even if there is no apriltag in view, but sometimes it points the wrong way. After checking the odometry using a Field2d on shuffleboard, we noticed that the pose coordinates would sometimes randomly jump to ridiculously high numbers (in the trilllions or something). Looking at an apriltag for a few seconds brought it back to normal. After a little more testing, we think that it was happening because the robot was browning out, but I want to be sure that it can’t happen during a match. Has anyone else experienced something similar?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-03-03T01:03:45.044Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":88,"reads":183,"readers_count":182,"score":491.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":456999,"topic_slug":"swervedriveposeestimator-randomly-gives-bad-coordinates","display_username":"Leo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63125,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/swervedriveposeestimator-randomly-gives-bad-coordinates/456999/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3322326,"name":"Ishaan Masilamony","username":"StarkOdinson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/starkodinson/{size}/191062_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-03T01:45:41.582Z","cooked":"

Are you using Spark MAXes?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-03-03T01:45:41.582Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":161,"readers_count":160,"score":37.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":456999,"topic_slug":"swervedriveposeestimator-randomly-gives-bad-coordinates","display_username":"Ishaan Masilamony","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58603,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8177 | Prog Lead"},"post_url":"/t/swervedriveposeestimator-randomly-gives-bad-coordinates/456999/2","custom_user_title":"8177 | Prog Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3322362,"name":"","username":"beng49","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/beng49/{size}/218018_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-03T03:16:27.265Z","cooked":"

What drive motors are you using? Can you run some checks on the data of your drive motor’s data to see if it ever returns values like NaN or > 10^9?

Our team experienced a very similar issue using Vortexes on our swerve, usually after a disable. After filtering out insane values from odometry we also found that at some points the flexes report values like NaN, which we also had to filter out from almost every flex we ran.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-03-03T03:28:23.038Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":150,"readers_count":149,"score":50.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":456999,"topic_slug":"swervedriveposeestimator-randomly-gives-bad-coordinates","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58898,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/swervedriveposeestimator-randomly-gives-bad-coordinates/456999/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3322415,"name":"Leo","username":"_leo","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/_/87869e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-03T04:54:01.228Z","cooked":"

We’re using spark maxes for steering motors and Neo vortexes for driving.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-03-03T04:54:01.228Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":124,"readers_count":123,"score":34.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":456999,"topic_slug":"swervedriveposeestimator-randomly-gives-bad-coordinates","display_username":"Leo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":58603,"username":"StarkOdinson","name":"Ishaan Masilamony","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/starkodinson/{size}/191062_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63125,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/swervedriveposeestimator-randomly-gives-bad-coordinates/456999/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3322416,"name":"Leo","username":"_leo","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/_/87869e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-03T04:57:07.624Z","cooked":"

We’re also using Vortexes, so I’ll check the individual encoder distances. I bet its something with spark flexes because we never had this problem on our old neo swerve robot.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-03-03T04:57:07.624Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":122,"readers_count":121,"score":24.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":456999,"topic_slug":"swervedriveposeestimator-randomly-gives-bad-coordinates","display_username":"Leo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":58898,"username":"beng49","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/beng49/{size}/218018_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63125,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/swervedriveposeestimator-randomly-gives-bad-coordinates/456999/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3322420,"name":"asa","username":"AngleSideAngle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/anglesideangle/{size}/179617_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-03T05:03:13.883Z","cooked":"

We have also experienced issues with our swerve odometry teleporting to ridiculous values (10^8, 10^8) using both spark maxes and flexes. It tended to happen when the driverstation state changed. I believe the issue is outlined here, where the bad values are caused by status frames failing to be sent.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-03-03T05:03:13.883Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":117,"readers_count":116,"score":83.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":456999,"topic_slug":"swervedriveposeestimator-randomly-gives-bad-coordinates","display_username":"asa","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/advantagekit-2024-log-replay-again/442968/193","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"AdvantageKit 2024: Log Replay, Again!","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54554,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1155 alumn"},"post_url":"/t/swervedriveposeestimator-randomly-gives-bad-coordinates/456999/6","custom_user_title":"1155 alumn","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3322515,"name":"Adithya Anand","username":"Adithya_Anand","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adithya_anand/{size}/208753_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-03T12:36:11.962Z","cooked":"

We’ve also had this problem before, and we were able to solve it by using throw out logic to filter out reported Pose2d values outside of the field. From AdvantageScope, we were able to determine that limelight sometimes gives ridiculously high values when it loses tracking or flickers between tags. We’ve been able to get decent pose estimation by having decent throughout logic and making sure we actually have a trustworthy pose before updating it. Also our standard deviations for limelight Pose3d when updating the pose estimator increases with distance.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-03-03T12:36:49.777Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":95,"readers_count":94,"score":29.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":456999,"topic_slug":"swervedriveposeestimator-randomly-gives-bad-coordinates","display_username":"Adithya Anand","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62693,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"177 Programming/Strategy Lead"},"post_url":"/t/swervedriveposeestimator-randomly-gives-bad-coordinates/456999/7","custom_user_title":"177 Programming/Strategy Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3322571,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-03T15:48:27.207Z","cooked":"

Throwing out ones outside the field is a good test. I wonder if comparing poses and either using a distance or velocity calculation versus the current position would be a good filter to discard unrealistic poses, since the robot can only move so fast?

I highly recommend teams send to Field2d (and/or log) not only the estimated robot pose but also the raw poses being fed from each source into the estimator. This will let you visualize what is going on.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-03-03T15:48:27.207Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":80,"readers_count":79,"score":21.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":456999,"topic_slug":"swervedriveposeestimator-randomly-gives-bad-coordinates","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":62693,"username":"Adithya_Anand","name":"Adithya Anand","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adithya_anand/{size}/208753_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/swervedriveposeestimator-randomly-gives-bad-coordinates/456999/8","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3322579,"name":"Jeremy Thorne","username":"jthorne","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/ce73a5/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-03T15:56:55.178Z","cooked":"

We’re doing the same thing. Are you using the AddVisionMeasurement() function in the pose estimator to update the estimator? What we quickly found doing experiments is that we couldn’t rely on the tag-based vision pose estimation unless we could see at least two tags. So as soon as we see two tags, we call AddVisionMeasurement. Otherwise, nope! We just let the NavX and the Swerve module guess what the pose is.

What’s really nice is that the starting position for the game has the Limelight looking right up at those lovely two April tags right there on the speaker. Thanks, FIRST field designers! Now we know exactly where our robot is, how it’s rotated, and which auto routine we should be running!

We’ll have to keep an eye on the pose estimator giving crazy values. We haven’t seen it yet, but glad to have a heads-up.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-03-03T15:57:31.565Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":75,"readers_count":74,"score":20.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":456999,"topic_slug":"swervedriveposeestimator-randomly-gives-bad-coordinates","display_username":"Jeremy Thorne","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44756,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/swervedriveposeestimator-randomly-gives-bad-coordinates/456999/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3322681,"name":"Ishaan Masilamony","username":"StarkOdinson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/starkodinson/{size}/191062_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-03T19:23:58.170Z","cooked":"

I was actually having this problem some time earlier, and I found 6328’s velocity/accel filter to work quite well for us. Here is the thread: https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/advantagekit-2024-log-replay-again/442968/180

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-03-03T19:23:58.170Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":59,"readers_count":58,"score":16.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":456999,"topic_slug":"swervedriveposeestimator-randomly-gives-bad-coordinates","display_username":"Ishaan Masilamony","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/advantagekit-2024-log-replay-again/442968/180","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"AdvantageKit 2024: Log Replay, Again!","clicks":20}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":13575,"username":"Peter_Johnson","name":"Peter Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58603,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8177 | Prog Lead"},"post_url":"/t/swervedriveposeestimator-randomly-gives-bad-coordinates/456999/10","custom_user_title":"8177 | Prog Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3341725,"name":"Leo","username":"_leo","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/_/87869e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-24T05:23:13.252Z","cooked":"

This is definitely the same thing that’s happening to us.
Luckily, we managed to survive a regional without it happening too much, but after some more testing, I noticed we always get a " [ CAN SPARK ] IDs: 3,5,7,9, timed out while waiting for periodic status" error whenever the odometry breaks. For some reason it only seems to be a problem with our drive motors, but I’ll add error checks for both drive and steering motors just to be safe.
